alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Central Walton; Coastal Bay; Holmes; Inland Bay; Jackson; North Walton; South Walton; Washington (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 09 at 3:44AM EDT until April 09 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A critical combination of strong winds, low humidity, and dry fuels is expected this afternoon over Northwest Florida... .Dry and gusty west to northwest winds will develop in the hours after sunrise this morning, in the wake of a reinforcing cold front last night. Where these weather conditions overlap with dry fuels, a Red Flag Warning will be in effect this afternoon. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WIND, LOW HUMIDITY, AND DRY FUELS FOR MOST OF NORTHWEST FLORIDA... The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon today to 7 PM CDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 007, 008, 009, 010, 011, 012, 013, 108, and 112. This includes all Florida counties west of the Apalachicola River, except Gulf County. * WIND...West to northwest winds 15 to 20 mph, with gusts near 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...Drying to 23 to 28 percent this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
